t: How to Avoid Products Made in China on Amazon - No to China 2024
s: May 5, 2024 - Amazon deliberately hides country of origin from most of its products. So how do you avoid made in China products? Find out here.

t: Why is Amazon full of made in China products? This is annoying. Why didn't Amazon create a made in the USA filter? - Quora

t: Pukemark, Sweatyrocks, Demonlick: Made-for-Amazon Brand Names Are Getting Ridiculously Surreal
s: October 14, 2020 - There are lots of brands that exist mainly or exclusively on Amazon, and it’s difficult to track down the stories behind them. It’s very common to see names made up of seemingly random combinations of letters, like Euymhod or WIHOLL. Most of these brands are based in China, and many are ...

t: Top 10 Products on Amazon from Chinese Sellers
s: Unfamiliar Brand Names Can Be a Liability ‍ A recurring challenge for Chinese sellers is the disconnect between brand presentation and customer trust. Many products are marketed under brand names that are difficult to pronounce or completely unfamiliar to Western consumers, which can hurt ...

t: Amazon says it’s permanently banned 600 Chinese brands for review fraud | The Verge
s: September 17, 2021 - Following the high-profile disappearances of Aukey, Mpow, RavPower, Choetech and more, Amazon now says it’s cracked down on 3,000 seller accounts across 600 Chinese brands over the past five months.

t: Amazon

t: Why has Amazon allowed China to pipeline their products directly to consumers without any options? Multiple times Chinese sellers reached out to me to buy my reviews, they offered money in exchange for me to change my bad reviews. Amazon was great. - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 2): Yes, probably initially Amazon just let it to happen in order to increase its subscribers. China is the only source of cheap but disposable goods. Most counterfeited and pirated products are made there. And you like cheap goods for Christmas presents, don’t you?
